de.esoco.lib.datatype

Class Period

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.datatype.Period
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Period
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A datatype that represent time and date periods and implements the corresponding date calculations.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Period.Unit
      Enumeration of the available period units.

    • Field Detail

      • NONE

        public static final Period NONE
        A constant for no period. This is a singleton instance that is restored on deserialization. Therefore it is safe to use it in instance comparisons.

      • HOURLY

        public static final Period HOURLY
        Constant for a one-hour period.

      • DAYLY

        public static final Period DAYLY
        Constant for a one-day period.

      • WEEKLY

        Constant for a one-week period.

      • MONTHLY

        Constant for a one-month period.

      • QUARTERLY

        public static final Period QUARTERLY
        Constant for a three-month period.

      • HALF_YEARLY

        public static final Period HALF_YEARLY
        Constant for a six-month period.

      • YEARLY

        public static final Period YEARLY
        Constant for a one-year period.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Period

        public Period(int nCount,
              Period.Unit eUnit)
        Creates a new instance.
        Parameters:
        nCount - The size of this period in counts of the given unit
        eUnit - The period unit
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the count is <= 0 or the unit is Period.Unit.NONE (which is reserved for internal use)

    • Method Detail

      • valueOf

        public static Period valueOf(java.lang.String sPeriod)
        Parses an instance from a string.
        Parameters:
        sPeriod - The string to parse
        Returns:
        A new period instance (or the singleton instance NONE)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the input string has the wrong format or contains an invalid unit
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the count part of the input string is no valid integer

      • endDate

        public java.util.Date endDate(java.util.Date rStartDate)
        Calculates the last date of this period relative to a certain start date. This is currently only supported for Period.Unit.DATE_UNITS where the calendar day will be adjusted to the corresponding period end.
        Parameters:
        rStartDate - The start date to calculate the period end date for
        Returns:
        The resulting date

        public final Period.Unit getUnit()
        Returns the period unit.
        Returns:

      • nextDate

        public java.util.Date nextDate(java.util.Date rDate)
        Calculates the next date according to this period.
        Parameters:
        rDate - The date to calculate the next period date of
        Returns:
        The resulting date

      • previousDate

        public java.util.Date previousDate(java.util.Date rDate)
        Calculates the previous date according to this period.
        Parameters:
        rDate - The date to calculate the previous period date of
        Returns:
        The resulting date

      • startDate

        public java.util.Date startDate(java.util.Date rEndDate)
        Calculates the last date of this period relative to a certain start date. This is currently only supported for Period.Unit.DATE_UNITS where the calendar day will be adjusted to the corresponding period start.
        Parameters:
        rEndDate - The start date to calculate the period end date for
        Returns:
        The resulting date

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this instance that can be parsed by the valueOf(String) method.
